intro: Khasianthus subsessilis, commonly known as the slender khasi hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in the summer months and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
